comment: One of my favorite bourbons. The extra toasting helps balance the sweetness of the regular Michters and gives it a smokey toasty flavor and more body. I never thought about the beer flavor connection, will have to have a taste and check that out.
I've really been enjoying this bourbon. Michter's has been putting out some great products. I get just a touch of smoke from the finishing process of using the toasted barrel. A great pour.
Wow, tons of bananas from the moment I poured it. Good bourbon, not too sweet and full of flavor, but you better like banana
This is intense for a bourbon, not as sweet as one would expect but the flavors are there. Tons of toasty vanilla and raisins on the finish. I like it.
Pretty unique bourbon.  It may just be my palate but I didn't pick up much smoke, rather sweetness, vanilla, and bananas foster.

I haven't been a huge fan of the Michter's bourbon because it is aggressively sweet.  The smokiness of the toasted barrel tempers the sweetness beautifully.  I'm pissed I didn't buy myself a bottle when I had the chance.
Anything  toasted has my undivided attention including bread. I was rooting for this to supersede the Unblended Michter but it didn't. It was a strong #2 and would drink it again and again
so good.. sweet, buttery and  reminded me of almonds and caramel popcorn.

Not quite as good as I was hoping but good nonetheless. Vanilla, oak, smoke and char are upfront. There is an interesting brine salt quality that none of the reviews I read mentioned that is paired with leather as a finish. Nice unique complexity.

Finish is hot, great burn that lingers. The perfect pain.
Smooth, Smokey, a little bit of an alcohol burn at the end (slightly better than Blanton’s but not a full score higher although not at all similar)
Stonefruit is apparently what that flavor is under the vanilla. Super sweet and fruity, I love it. It lingers on the tail for a long time. Vaniiiiilllaaaaa. Burn can be a little much though.
Nose of rich caramel & milk chocolate with light baking spices. Strong milk chocolate on the mid-palate with a medium length finish. Solid pour, & worth the time to taste if you find it available.
Tastes like the base with more vanillin.

sweet, spicy, not super oily

it's got a sorta peppery, cinnamon-y finish
Tastes great neat, will have to buy a bottle
Good, but improves by leaps and bounds with aging.
very shy on first nose and taste but opened up into fresh grain bread.  good but toasted rye will probably be better
Fairly standard nose with a woody taste. Not bad by any means, but not worth the cost by a long shot
Light on the palate, but has an amazing nose and taste of vanilla creme brule!
Sweet and good, hint of honey
Really nice change of pace from traditional bourbon.
Nose is smokey and sweet. I lose the smokiness on the palate. Sweet and fruity with a short finish. Lots of cinnamon.
Tastes very close to the rye. Very smooth
smooth and warm at the end
Beats Weller 12 year and a solid competitor with Blanton

This was part of a three tasting flight - and second of this triple flight.  As you start to taste it, you get a hint of orange, apple, and a hint of toasted wood. This is a smooth start but a sharp finish. It's a bourbon that would pair well with a beer or two.
It was decent but did not find anything too special about it. Had a sample. Probably would not buy it at the msrp price point
Toasting adds extra smooth oakiness onto a normal somewhat hot rye finish. Little noses of carmel, clove, and spices really bring depth
Noticed cinnamon and camp fire. I usually don’t like smokiness in my whiskeys but this was subtle and enjoyable. Settled around my tongue, hitting me more on the sides and back of mouth.
